english_translation: Narrated by Uqbah ibn Amr: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ appointed us to meet at the base of al-Aqabah on the day of sacrifice, and we were seventy men. Uqbah said: I was the youngest among them in age. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ came to us and said: 'Be brief in the speech, for I fear the disbelievers of Quraysh for you.' We said: 'O Messenger of Allah, ask for your Lord, ask for yourself, ask for your Companions, and tell us what reward we will have from Allah and from you.' He said: 'I ask for my Lord that you believe in Him and not associate anything with Him. I ask you to obey me and I will guide you to the path of righteousness. I ask you for myself and my Companions that you console us with what you have and protect us from what you protect yourselves from. If you do that, you will have Paradise from Allah and from me.' He said: 'So we extended our hands and pledged to him.'

english_translation: Narrated by Ka'b ibn Malik: He left Madinah intending to meet the Messenger of Allah ﷺ, and he did not know the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. He went out asking about the Messenger of Allah ﷺ, and a man met them at al-Abtah. They asked him about the Prophet. He said: 'Do you know him?' They said: 'No.' He said: 'Do you know al-Abbas ibn Abd al-Muttalib?' They said: 'Yes,' and we knew him and he knew us. He said: 'He is the man sitting with him in the mosque.' So we entered and there was al-Abbas and the Messenger of Allah ﷺ with him. We greeted them and sat down. We asked al-Abbas, and the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Who are these two, O Abbas?' He said: 'This is al-Bara' ibn Ma'rur, and this is Ka'b ibn Malik.' The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'The poet?' Then the Messenger of Allah ﷺ appointed us to meet at al-Aqabah in the middle of the days of Tashriq. We gathered for the Messenger of Allah ﷺ at al-Aqabah, and we were seventy men and two women. The Prophet ﷺ came with al-Abbas, and there was no one with him other than him. Al-Abbas began the speech and said: 'O Bani al-Khazraj, Muhammad is in protection and defense from his people, and we have protected him from those who wanted him, so no one can reach him with anything he dislikes. He has refused except to join you for what you promised him. If you sense weakness or frailty or abandonment in yourselves, then now leave him with his people, for he is in protection.' Then the hadith continues at length.
